form_title.ms_form_title_llm_v1: FOREIGN SERVICE MEDICAL EXAMINATION OF VISA APPLICANTS, FS-396

full_text: STANGEL Form FS-398 PLACE (Reg. May 1953) FOREIGN SERVICE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA FQ; USPHS, Toronto DATE MEDICAL EXAMINATION OF VISA APPLICANTS April 24, 1957 CITY COUNTRY At the request of the American Consul at Toronto Canada NAME AGE SEX I certify that on the above date I examined Mr. Herbert STANGEL 51 M I examined specifically for evidence of any of the following conditions: CLASS A: TUBERCULOSIS (in any form) LEPROSY (Hansen's Disease) DANGEROUS CONTAGIOUS DISEASES: Actinomycosis Granuloma Inguinale Ringworm of scalp Amebiasis Keratoconjunctivitis infections Schistosomiasis Blastomycosis Leishmaniasis Syphilis, infectious stage Chancroid Lymphogranuloma Venereum Trachoma Favus Mycetoma Trypanosomiasis Filariasis Paragonimiasis Yaws Gonorrhea MENTAL CONDITIONS: Feeble-mindedness Previous occurrence of one or more Mental defect (mental deficiency) attacks of insanity Narcotic drug addiction Insanity Psychopathic personality Chronic alcoholism Epilepsy (Idiopathic) (See proviso, sec. 34.7, USPHS Regs.) CLASS B: Physical Defect, Disease, or Disability Serious in Degree or Permanent in Nature Amounting to a Substantial Departure from Normal Physical Well-Being. CLASS C: Minor Conditions. (Check number (1) below or complete number (2) ) My examination, including the X-ray and other reports below, revealed: (2) Defect, disease, or disability, or previous occurrence of one or more attacks of insanity, as follows (give class-A, B, or C-diagnosis, and pertinent details*) : 11 C " Bronchitis chronic, mild; asymptomatic Chest X-ray report April 13, 1957: 11 The hilar shadows are slightly more dense than normal; the bronchial tree is thickened, at the base; the changes appear to be non-tubercular in oroigin. ( Denies history of tbc. Toronto, April 17/57 from Dr. G.R.Reid, Radiologist. Blood serological report Negative April 18/57 from Dr. Urinalysis report XX SIGNATURE OF MEDICAL EXAMINER TITLE from W Hain Medical Officer, USPHS *Continue on reverse side if necessary. GPO 946030
